info.title: Tallyfy API
info.description:
Tallyfy is the most user-friendly and developer-friendly workflow management platform available - and it's built with an integration-first approach - entirely on top of a modern REST API. This gives you unlimited flexibility to push, pull and listen to events + data within Tallyfy. To use the API, sign up at https://account.tallyfy.com and then if you're on a paid plan or approved manually - you can access our API directly using your personal access_token. You can use this Swagger page to actually call the API - but we strongly recommend using a proper REST API client like Postman. An introductory guide to using the API is here.

An important note about endpoints - the endpoint https://go.tallyfy.com/api should only be used by our client user interface. All other API requests from other clients need to use https://api.tallyfy.com as an endpoint. Organizations in trial may not have any direct API access - so you may need to write to our support team to request access, or upgrade your organization to a paid plan - which automatically grants you API access.

Terminology between the web app and the API can be different. For example - a template on the UI is a blueprint on the API. Please reach out to us via our support site or create a GitHub ticket on our public repo if you have any issues - we're happy to help! Note that we only support TLS version 1.2+ for connections and impose rate limits to protect our infrastructure.
  1. There's two ways to access the API - a personal token or a special client integration:
    • The easiest and most common way to access our API is via your personal access token - an access_token. While logged in to Tallyfy, navigate to Settings > Integrations > REST API > access_token to get your token.
    • For client apps and dedicated clients only - you can apply for a unique Client ID and Client Secret. Reach out to us (or email support (at) tallyfy.com) in order to request your own Client ID and Secret. Make a call to /oauth/token with your Client ID, Client Secret, Grant Type, Required Scopes, Username (Email), and Password. Save the access_token from the response. More details are in the API documentation below in the 'Authentication' section.
  2. Once you've obtained the access_token via either of the methods above - add it as a header to your HTTPS calls as Authorization: Bearer {access_token} in all subsequent requests to protected endpoints. You must add the headers Accept: application/json AND X-Tallyfy-Client: APIClient as well.

get.description: Retrieve file meta data from file uploaded to a form field or kick-off field

post.summary: Upload a file to a form
post.description: Create an asset for either a Kick-Off field or a Task form field. For Kick-Off fields, you will be able to download the asset using the following link: https://go.tallyfy.com/api/organizations/{org}/file/{file_id}/dl. For uploading a file to a task, after making this call you must then make a PUT call to `https://go.tallyfy.com/api/organizations/{org}/runs/{step_id}/tasks/{id}` with the following request body: `{"taskdata":{"{Form Field ID}": [{Data}]}}`. Where `{Form Field ID}` is replaced with the Form Field ID and `{Data}` is replaced with everything inside the "data" value of this call's response

parameters.name: uploaded_from
parameters.description: For uploading to a Kick-Off field, this will be 'ko_field'. For uploading to a Task, this will be the Form Field Id for that Task.

parameters.name: subject_type
parameters.description: For uploading to a Kick-Off field, this will be 'Checklist'. For uploading to a Task, this will be 'Run'

parameters.name: subject_id
parameters.description: For uploading to a Kick-Off field, this will be the Template Id. For uploading to a Task, this will be the Process Id

parameters.name: checklist_id
parameters.description: Template Id, only required for uploading to a Task

parameters.name: step_id
parameters.description: Step Id, only required for uploading to a Task

get.description: Retrieve an uploaded file. Add `dl` to the end of the URL to download the file

delete.description: Delete a file from a form field

tasks.description:
Array of Tasks with the key is the ID of a Step's checklist, the value is the position and deadline of these steps. In case of missing this field, all Steps of the Process will be selected.
The deadline is the due time of a Task, if it is not specified, the default due time is 1 hour from run creation time

parameters.description: Get a comma-separated list of related data

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Get checklists by type passing: procedure, form, document

parameters.name: entire_folder_tree
parameters.description: Get the checklist's entire folder tree.

parameters.name: with
parameters.description: Get comma-separated data associated to a process

parameters.name: task_status
parameters.description: Get processes by one of the following task statuses: all, in-progress, completed,

parameters.name: groups
parameters.description: Search Process Tasks assigned to specific group. Ex: groups=14b82580fe162a66825fa81e490e178b,we344280fe162a66825fa81e490e178b

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Get processes by one of the following statuses: active, problem, delayed, complete, archived

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Get processes by type passing: procedure, form, document

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: For the request body - you can use either ID or alias to specify a template

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Get special tags by passing status: special

parameters.name: with
parameters.description: Include statistics with tags by passing statistics in with

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Get special tags by passing status: special

parameters.name: with
parameters.description: Include statistics with tags by passing statistics in with

field_type.example: text | textarea | dropdown | multiselect | radio | date | file | table
text or textarea. (Only for creating new Kick-Off field)

id.example: <Kick-Off Field ID>. (Only for existing Kick-Off fields)

tags.description: Array of tags associated to this template.

items.example: Number of values must be equal to number of columns

warning.example: For the domain tallyfy.com, we have detected 266 other organizations that have claimed this domain as their own - please contact support@tallyfy.com to resolve this issue.

description.example: Launch a process every Friday at 2pm CST

tasks.description:
Array of Tasks with the key is the ID of a Step's checklist, the value is the position and deadline of these steps. In case of missing this field, all Steps of the Process will be selected.
The deadline is the due time of a Task, if it is not specified, the default due time is 1 hour from run creation time

prerun.description: Kickoff fields data structure is dependent on type of kickoff field. There are 7 kickoff field types including date, image, checklist, dropdown, radio buttons, small text fields and large text fields.

tags.description: Array of tags associated to this template.

roles.description: roles object includes user IDs array, guest's emails array and group IDs array.

example.field: type      | folder      | members     | groups       | tag_ids    | status  | manual
example.value: procedure | <Folder Id> | [<User Id>] | [<Group Id>] | [<Tag Id>] | started | Search Text

watching.example: {object details of user, checklist, run or task}

steps.description: Array of steps to create with the template

field_type.example: text | textarea | dropdown | multiselect | radio | date | file | table

position.description: New position within the target step

tags.name: List
tags.description: Operations on a table of data

tags.name: Watching
tags.description: Operations on favorites being watched by a member

tags.name: Token
tags.description: Get access token using client ID and client secret.

tags.name: Capture
tags.description: Operations on form fields within steps

tags.name: Process Instances
tags.description: Operations on a unique process instance

tags.name: Folder
tags.description: Operations on folders for templates and workflows

tags.name: Tag
tags.description: Tags on templates, processes, tasks and steps

tags.name: Form Field
tags.description: Operations on form fields in tasks or kick-off forms

tags.name: Comment
tags.description: Operations on in-line comments on selected text

tags.name: Group
tags.description: Operations on groups and group membership

tags.name: Favorites
tags.description: Favorite operations on templates and processes
